verification.payload:
tree c09a11b25a965de356113876bb31e59f3a26e779
parent 23d779dcf5d961dbba9fd47808e138f770e00354
author Matthew Zipkin <pinheadmz@pm.me> 1747333091 -0400
committer Matthew Zipkin <pinheadmz@pm.me> 1747333091 -0400

rpc: add decoded tx details to gettransaction with extra wallet fields

events.message: rpc: add decoded tx details to gettransaction with extra wallet fields

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -118,6 +118,7 @@ static std::vector<RPCResult> DecodeTxDoc(const std::string& txid_field_doc)
                 {RPCResult::Type::STR_AMOUNT, "value", "The value in " + CURRENCY_UNIT},
                 {RPCResult::Type::NUM, "n", "index"},
                 {RPCResult::Type::OBJ, "scriptPubKey", "", ScriptPubKeyDoc()},
+                {RPCResult::Type::BOOL, "ischange", /*optional=*/true, "Output script is change (only if wallet transaction and true for selected rpcwallet)"},
comments.body:
nit: Not sure about making this optional out of convenience and then write the rule in the description string.

It would be better to just pass down a `std::optionl<RPCResult>` (or `std::vector<RPCResult>`) here, and then use `Cat()` to concatenate it?

I started with this but then playing with the feature I made it optional because if you receive a payment you'd see a tx with a bunch of outputs that all say `ischange: false`. I felt like that was confusing because you didn't create this tx and that might imply that there is some way to detect a change output in someone else's tx.

comments.body: Not sure what you mean here -- `help gettransaction` doesn't list this at all, it just tells the user to check `decoderawtransaction`
